subject: Re: [junit] Avoiding Hard coded locations
msgSnippet: Hi Scott, Sorry if my question wasn t clear, yea I know about File,  But lets say I m on /home/cormac and another guy gets my code and he s on /home/jim I
messageBody:
Hi Scott,
Sorry if my question wasn't clear, yea I know about File, But lets say
I'm on /home/cormac and another guy gets my code and he's on /home/jim
I can't then hard code in File f = new
File("/home/cormac/junitTestDir");
I have a script which you download as well which creates this directory
and puts the sample XML documents into it.
I can use SourceResourceLoader.getResourceAsStream(this.getClass(),"Name
of file"); to get an InputStream to a file but I dot know how to get a
File class from this. Any Idea's.
Cormac

Scott Coleman wrote:

> Why not just use File? this has the ability to navigate a directory.
